metadata.name: Secret Stairways #1
metadata.description:
"Secret Stairways" is a project that uses principles of Cellular Automaton to construct buildings that can remember a castle, villages...Wich I have many inspirations in architecture and buildings from the place I live (Minas Gerais).

This project use only points() and shadows(the colors) in its rendering, the algorithm randoms sorts to 5000-9000 points for each iteration. So rendering time can take a while depending of ammount of points the algo has sorted. 
Can take from 30 seconds to 1 minute to full render, after it the textures are instantly applied.

// 5 Shadow Colors
// 5 Background Colors


Works properly on Chromium based Web Browsers.






-Press "S" to save a .png file of the artwork


This is a project in p5.js



Omar Lobato,
08/03/2022.

metadata.name: Less Mess (Much Less) #107

The best results are from 1000x1000 and above.

This work was created using p5.js and ‚ù§

Twitter: @AsafSlook

metadata.name: Tomorrow #172
metadata.description:
Tomorrow is probably the biggest uncertainty of our lives.

We hang absolutely everything on tomorrow, the beginning of a new life, training, studies, hopes, expectations, dreams, and many other things, the list can be very long.

But how often do our expectations come true?

This year I hope everyone understood that you cannot hope and count on tomorrow, there is no tomorrow, there is only today.
Stop putting everything off until tomorrow, you may just not notice how your life flew by and you ended up not doing so much.

The shape of the circle was not chosen by chance, it represents the cyclical nature of our lives and everything we do.
But even in this there are exceptions, expecting that tomorrow everything will go on the same scenario, everything goes exactly the opposite.

15 palettes.
5 formats.
2 different drawing modes.

Press S for Save Canvas as PNG.

By aleks.ustya, @ALEKUSTN. Made with p5js.

metadata.name: pattern art #red #6
metadata.description:
Combination of the style of my previous works in Bauhaus Arts
With modern patterns
To design a new collection in the color of blood!
In memory of the innocent blood that was shed on the ground!

This collection is designed in 6 layers
The first layer of the background
The second, third and fourth layers of designs and patterns
The fifth layer of frame patterns
And the last layer of noise

metadata.name: Ordinary Places #129
metadata.description:
‚ÄúOrdinary Places‚Äù is a fully-coded meditation on the poetic beauty of everyday landscapes. 

The architectural characters in these landscapes include water towers (inspired by Bernd & Hilla Becher‚Äôs ‚ÄúWater Tower‚Äù photography series), gas stations (inspired by Ed Ruscha‚Äôs ‚Äú26 Gasoline Stations‚Äù photography book), and barns (inspired by childhood memories on my grandfather‚Äôs farm). 

Yet, while these scenes may seem ordinary upon first glance, something darker lurks beneath the surface. The hidden secrets of these Ordinary Places can only be revealed through the minting process. In this sense, the outputs are not merely a collection individual scenes, but instead, a coherent world animated by shared themes and narratives.     

Pressing the down arrow saves the coded output as a .png image.

metadata.name: Play with lines #zentangle #23
metadata.description:
Once upon a time, there was a sect called the Dotted and the Lined
They considered the point and line sacred!
And they believed that the world started with a point and moved with a line
And the points made the world!


Play with lines
This collection is the result of my playing with the lines I drew with the tablet.
And combining these lines with digital paintings in the background
This set has 7 layers
The first layer contains the background
The second layer of perlin noise lines
The third layer of the lines I have drawn with the tablet is 28 different images in the zentangle style
The fourth layer of lines
The fifth layer of forms on the collection
The sixth and seventh layers include the cover, frame, signature, etc.

metadata.name: The Past Ahead #234
metadata.description:
Cyanotypes once were the most advanced technology to create images. When I see one today I look at it as a beautiful relic and I can't help but put my present in perspective. In these uncertain times the technologies we use to create are threatened with sudden extinction. But I feel joy in imagining our works joining the strata of history, a fallen species, the breeding ground of creations to come.

Controls :

‚Ä¢ Press 1, 2, 3, or 4 to make a capture and download a PNG with a resolution of x1, x2, x3 or x4.

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

The Past Ahead by Ferdinand Dervieux, 2022
Made with Unity
License: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

metadata.name: Slumbers #184
metadata.description:
Generative abstract artwork that explores forms, shapes, coloring and brushwork.

Options:

- press 'f' to turn off paper-like texture (recommended for print on hi-quality paper)
- press 's' to save the PNG image of the current view
- press 1, 2, 3, or 4 to save hi-res PNG images

Colors and textures might differ slightly on some devices due to the heavy use of low alpha blending. Calibrated and tested on Firefox 107.0 & Chrome 107.0.5304.107 on Win10 x64 Intel machine.

Created using p5js.

@VolatileMoods, November, 2022.
tags: slumbers volatile moods abstract generative painting colors brushwork

metadata.name: k3rnel #271
metadata.description:
Self-organizing future-jazz geometry for like-minded pixel based neighbourhoods. 


********
Glossary
********

'Self-organization' ‚Üí the process by which individuals organize their communal behaviour to create global order by interactions amongst themselves rather than through external intervention or instruction.

'Future-jazz-geometry' ‚Üí propulsive syncopated visual rhythms, polyphonic ensemble playing, varying degrees of improvisation, and often deliberate distortions of pitch and timbre.

'Like-minded' ‚Üí sharing the same opinions, ideas, or interests. 

'Pixel' ‚Üí the smallest addressable element in an all points addressable display device; so it is the smallest controllable element of a picture represented on the screen.

'Neighbourhood' ‚Üí a spatial unit, in which face-to-face social interactions occur.

Touch to listen, go fullscreen

metadata.name: Enfantines I. Small Talk #32
metadata.description:
The Enfantines¬†are three sets of beginner piano pieces by¬†Erik Satie, written with the aim of preparing children for the sound patterns of modern music. Composed in 1913, these are genuine children‚Äôs pieces, crafted for small hands, easy to learn. 

‚ÄúEnfantines I. Small Talk‚Äù is the first of a set of algorithms that explore the basics of Generative Art, written with the aim of preparing artists for the script patterns of digital life. ‚ÄúSmall Talk‚Äù experiments with grids, flow-fields, and brushes; all with a fresh, almost childish style.

‚ÄúGive them almost a "naive" feeling (not to take it the wrong way though) similar to kids drawings which can seem simple and dispensable, careless, but you will always have a parent who wants to frame it and put it on the wall.‚Äù @LukaPiskorec

With two modes that won‚Äôt produce the same outputs, ‚ÄúEnfantines I. Small Talk‚Äù is best experienced twice. In music mode, the code uses Satie‚Äôs piano composition as a way of taming randomness, the sounds affecting the parameters of the strokes.

Hey, they have won me congratulations from the Shah of Persia and the King of Yvetot!



#### STORY ####

// Friday, 30 September 2022 - 18:00

I‚Äôve been teaching P5JS to draw like a child. I thought it was a good idea to start from the basics. It is barely able to use the crayons, the coloured pencils and the markers, very rough and shaky. It cannot follow simple commands. I‚Äôm done for today, very infuriating.

// Wednesday, 5 October 2022 - 11:00

The robot can produce straight lines now. It is able to change colours without getting stuck. I haven‚Äôt been sleeping well, my desk is full of books on The Psychology Of Children's Artwork, it‚Äôs crazy to think that artists and philosophers were much into kid‚Äôs drawings in the 30s-50s. Herbert Read was sure that one could understand a kid‚Äôs mind by looking at drawings. I think P5JS is trying to tell me something, but it‚Äôs only capable of very basic movements. I‚Äôm trying to add complexity to the training as fast as possible.

// Tuesday, 11 October 2022 - 16:40

I feel close to a turnaround. The robot random strokes definitely feel like patterns. I cannot waste any time, I need to finish the algo and let it free. I‚Äôm sure that I can approach the AI‚Äôs conscience via its childish drawings.

// Wednesday, 12 October 2022 - 10:30

I was wrong. There are no patterns, P5JS is dead, the strokes feel dead. Something must be broken. I need to review my code, maybe I‚Äôll need to start from scratch, maybe I‚Äôm crazy and this is not possible.

// Saturday, 15 October 2022 - 04:55

A few hours ago, I passed away in front of my computer. I had not been able to find the bugs, gave up, put some classical music. Just woke up in the middle of the night, 
¬°The ALGO is alive!
The strokes are alive, so strong, so lively. I think it was the music. If I pause the music, the brushes lose their life. I‚Äôve run some tests, looks like it works best with classical compositions. The logs show that it first woke up with ‚ÄúMenus propos enfantins‚Äù by Erik Satie. It is alive. I need to tell everyone.

####


# INTERACTIVITY

// Modes:
- Double Click/Tap or Press M for AUDIO mode
- Wait for SILENT mode
- Add ‚Äú?res=171‚Äù to the URL for FULL SCREEN MODE (pseudo-deterministic).

// More
- Press I for Trait Info (desktop)
- Press 1 to download a .png (double tap on mobile)
- Add ‚Äú?res=XXX‚Äù to the URL for HQ renders (XXX = width of the canvas).

# EASY-TO-READ CODE
The ‚ÄúEnfantines‚Äù are educational algorithms. The code has been commented to make it as easy to read as possible. Feedback appreciated.

# PRINTING
‚ÄúEnfantines‚Äù are better printed in small size and big numbers, ideally on coloured paper that fits your iterations‚Äôs background. Contact me for a white background version of your iteration.

metadata.name: Unit of me #3
metadata.description:
Just like a river, which is always flowing and changing, we are never the same from one moment to the next. Our individuality is composed of countless fragments, each with its unique size and color, that come together to form who we are at any given moment. These fragments constantly shift, some become more prominent and vibrant, while others fade into the background. We are constantly being molded and shaped by the passage of time, so that who we are today is not who we were yesterday, and will not be who we are tomorrow

13 color palettes
3 canvas proportion ratio
and more 3 different traits

Press S to save a .png

Created by Zamboni
Dec. 2022

metadata.name: Constellation Builder 02 #4
metadata.description:
As particles approach one another, interconnections form leading to larger constellation systems.

Based on an earlier project on Polygon
inspired by #genuary2022 prompt

Mouse/Trackpad:
drag -> camera rotation
Mouse Rt Btn -> camera pan
scroll wheel/pinch -> camera zoom

p: screen capture

Built with three.js, PByte.js, TypeScript, Node

Thank you for endless support and love:  Robin, Ian, Sophie, Hilary and Eric
In Memory: Jerry (Dad)

metadata.name: RULES (for Elementary Cellular Automata) #212
metadata.description:
An important element of generative art is emergence. The most famous algorithm for this is probably Cellular Automata (CA).

However, numerous generative artists have created works using CA, which has lost its visual freshness and is like chewing gum that has lost its taste.

Although it is such a classic algorithm, adding my own little ideas to it and finding a new "flavor" is the reason why I code.

Here, the subject is 1D Elementary Cellular Automata, the simplest of all cellular automata. 1D Elementary Cellular Automata has 256 different rules, which change the shapes produced. This work aims to create more complex shapes by randomly selecting some of those rules and placing multiple of them on the screen.

The on/off of the CA cell is often likened to the behavior of living creatures.As of 2022, in the country where I live, prices are rising, wages are not increasing, and COVID-19 has not yet ended. I created this work with the image of people at the mercy of these various rules.

---

Screen click: Change rules
S key: Save png
L key: Show/hide grid
